definition: to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)

sentences.english: He lit his pipe and exhaled clouds of smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他点燃烟斗并且吞云吐雾。

sentences.english: I hope you get sick when someone blows smoke in your face .
sentences.chinese: 我希望有人在你面前吞云吐雾时你会恶心。

definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
one leg over the other (legs crossed)
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
